ygData.subject: Re: WEAPONS for my PET
ygData.msgSnippet: Don t forget you ll need to get a rusty weapon everytime your skel DIES. At that level don t hesitate to step in there from the very beginning with your skel
ygData.messageBody:
Don't forget you'll need to get a rusty weapon everytime your skel
DIES.

At that level don't hesitate to step in there from the very
beginning with your skel and help kill it. Usually you can beat up
something pretty good double teaming, then stepping back and draining, then
stepping back in. Doing this you should be able to handle yellow
spiderlings and beetles fairly easily. Just watch for teamups and
gangbangs, ESPECIALLY with the spiders. Always look around between strikes
to make sure there's not other spiderlings bearing down on you.

Malark on Karana

> > >
> > > belphenor
> > >
> > >
> > > >From: Guillaume Voizard <gvoizard@...>
> > > >
> > > >You can give a weapon to your pet, but you can not take it
> > > back. :o(
> > > >I think that pets have the same level of knowledge than a
> > > warrior of the
> > > >same level. So you can give him any weapon you want, but you
> > > must know that
> > > >it will be lost for you. So if you have a huge amount of
> hundreds of
> > > >platinum, may be you can waste some dwarven battle axes for
> > > your pets. :o)
> > > >About dmg, think about your pet as a warrior who maxed his
> > > skills. No
> > > >weapon
> > > >-> hand to hand, weapon -> more dmg (but what about the delay ?)
> > > >
> > > >Taldir, Teir'Dal in Innoruuk.
> > > >
